title: Large rock
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Name                                           | Large rock                       |
| :--------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| Launcher                                       | [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") |
| Base damage                                    | 20                               |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 20 (200%)                        |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at skill 26                    |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A very large and very heavy stone. Only large creatures are capable of throwing it.***"Well, I run to the rock and I hide my face The rock cried out, No hiding place There's no hiding place down here."-Negro spiritual. 19th cent. |

**Large rocks** are massive [throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") weapons. Only [trolls](/Troll "Troll"), [ogres](/Ogre "Ogre"), and [giants](/List_of_giants "List of giants") have the sheer size necessary to throw these effectively. They have the best damage of all throwing projectiles, but have a high base delay. At Throwing 0, it takes 2 full turns in order to throw one.

Large rocks have a 4% chance of [mulching](/Mulch "Mulch") when thrown, slightly lower than other physical projectiles. This destroys the rock, though does +33% more damage.

## Strategy

Strong at high skill. It's often worth training Throwing on large species. Even at low skill, it can be worth throwing at melee enemies, though watch out for the delay. (If you don't have high Throwing skill, don't throw at a melee enemy at melee range.)

Another *large* benefit of rocks is that they are plentiful - often carried by [cyclopses](/Cyclops "Cyclops") and [stone giants](/Stone_giant "Stone giant"). Large rocks are more common than [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang") and [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") *combined*.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) In the late game, this makes large rocks a lot more disposable than javelins, since the latter can pierce through enemies.

| Large Rock                                           |
| ---------------------------------------------------- |
| [![Rock.png](/images/0/0b/Rock.png)](/File:Rock.png) |

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), mulched large rocks did not get bonus damage.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [exploding](/Exploding_\(brand\) "Exploding (brand)") large rocks could be found in a rare ammunition shop.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), large rocks could be used by ogres and trolls to vastly increase the power of their [Sandblast](/Sandblast "Sandblast") spells.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), the attack speed of Throwing weapons did not rely on your Throwing skill, making large rocks much easier to utilize even without training.
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), they had a mulch rate of 2%, and their range was somewhat randomized; attempting to throw them long distances with low [strength](/Strength "Strength") would often result in a toss that comes short of its target.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), there was an ammunition shop that sold large rocks with the following brands: [returning](/Returning "Returning"), [exploding](/Exploding_\(brand\) "Exploding (brand)"), [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos"), [poisoned](/Poisoned "Poisoned"), [dispersal](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)"), [flame](/Flame "Flame"), and [frost](/Frost "Frost").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), large rocks were inherently [penetrating](/Penetration "Penetration").
- Prior to [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), [mulching](/Mulch "Mulch") a large rock would create a stack of stones.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [Objstats 0.29 (Shoals/Spider)](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-SfdqTkjUkQ9kB9hyJTqt7grYzSDibv-XpPbEEFinCQ/edit#gid=523653744)

| [Weapons](/Weapon "Weapon")                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                                 | [Battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe") • [Broad axe](/Broad_axe "Broad axe") • [Executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") • [Hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe") • [War axe](/War_axe "War axe")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") | [Club](/Club "Club") • [Demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") • [Dire flail](/Dire_flail "Dire flail") • [Eveningstar](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar") • [Flail](/Flail "Flail") • [Giant club](/Giant_club "Giant club") • [Giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club") • [Great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace") • [Mace](/Mace "Mace") ([Hammer](/Hammer "Hammer")) • [Morningstar](/Morningstar "Morningstar") • [Sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge") • [Whip](/Whip "Whip") |
| [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")            | [Demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade") • [Double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword") • [Eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade") • [Falchion](/Falchion "Falchion") • [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword") • [Long sword](/Long_sword "Long sword") • [Scimitar](/Scimitar "Scimitar") • [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")                                                                                                                                                     |
| [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")                     | [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") • [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") • [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") • [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") ([Scythe](/Scythe "Scythe")) • [Spear](/Spear "Spear") • [Trident](/Trident "Trident") • [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")   | [Arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest") • [Hand cannon](/Hand_cannon "Hand cannon") • [Longbow](/Longbow "Longbow") • [Orcbow](/Orcbow "Orcbow") • [Shortbow](/Shortbow "Shortbow") • [Sling](/Sling "Sling") • [Triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")         | [Dagger](/Dagger "Dagger") • [Quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") • [Rapier](/Rapier "Rapier") • [Short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| [Staves](/Staves "Staves")                           | [Lajatang](/Lajatang "Lajatang") • [Magical staff](/Magical_staff "Magical staff") • [Quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")                     | [Boomerang](/Boomerang "Boomerang") • [Dart](/Dart "Dart") • [Javelin](/Javelin "Javelin") • [Large rock]() • [Stone](/Stone "Stone") • [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
html:
Large rock

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Large rock
Launcher Throwing
Base damage 20
Base delay (%) 20 (200%)
Min delay 7 at skill 26
A very large and very heavy stone. Only large creatures are capable of throwing it.

"Well, I run to the rock and I hide my face
The rock cried out, No hiding place
There's no hiding place down here."

-Negro spiritual. 19th cent.

Large rocks are massive throwing weapons. Only trolls, ogres, and giants have the sheer size necessary to throw these effectively. They have the best damage of all throwing projectiles, but have a high base delay. At Throwing 0, it takes 2 full turns in order to throw one.

Large rocks have a 4% chance of mulching when thrown, slightly lower than other physical projectiles. This destroys the rock, though does +33% more damage.

Strategy

Strong at high skill. It's often worth training Throwing on large species. Even at low skill, it can be worth throwing at melee enemies, though watch out for the delay. (If you don't have high Throwing skill, don't throw at a melee enemy at melee range.)

Another large benefit of rocks is that they are plentiful - often carried by cyclopses and stone giants. Large rocks are more common than boomerangs and javelins combined.[1] In the late game, this makes large rocks a lot more disposable than javelins, since the latter can pierce through enemies.

Large Rock

History

  • Prior to 0.30, mulched large rocks did not get bonus damage.
  • Prior to 0.24, exploding large rocks could be found in a rare ammunition shop.
  • Prior to 0.20, large rocks could be used by ogres and trolls to vastly increase the power of their Sandblast spells.
  • Prior to 0.18, the attack speed of Throwing weapons did not rely on your Throwing skill, making large rocks much easier to utilize even without training.
  • Prior to 0.16, they had a mulch rate of 2%, and their range was somewhat randomized; attempting to throw them long distances with low strength would often result in a toss that comes short of its target.
  • Prior to 0.15, there was an ammunition shop that sold large rocks with the following brands: returning, exploding, chaos, poisoned, dispersal, flame, and frost.
  • Prior to 0.13, large rocks were inherently penetrating.
  • Prior to 0.11, mulching a large rock would create a stack of stones.

References

  1. ↑ Objstats 0.29 (Shoals/Spider)
Weapons
Axes Battleaxe • Broad axe • Executioner's axe • Hand axe • War axe
Maces & Flails Club • Demon whip • Dire flail • Eveningstar • Flail • Giant club • Giant spiked club • Great mace • Mace (Hammer) • Morningstar • Sacred scourge • Whip
Long Blades Demon blade • Double sword • Eudemon blade • Falchion • Great sword • Long sword • Scimitar • Triple sword
Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow
Short Blades Dagger • Quick blade • Rapier • Short sword
Staves Lajatang • Magical staff • Quarterstaff
Throwing Boomerang • Dart • Javelin • Large rock • Stone • Throwing net
